content.text: Solve.
Work out.
Give your answer correct to 2 significant figures.
shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\)
shape \(A\) onto shape \(C\).
Describe fully the single transformation that maps
On the grid, draw the image of shape \(A\) after a reflection in the line \(x=-2\).
In the USA, one gallon of fuel costs \(\$ 4.83\) . In the UK, one litre of fuel costs \(\pounds 1.62\) .
The exchange rate is \(\pounds 1=\$ 1.215\) . 1 gallon \(= 3.785\) litres
In which country does 1 litre of fuel cost more and by how much? Give your answer in dollars.
These are the first 5 terms of a sequence.
Find the 10th term of this sequence.
These are the first 5 terms of a different sequence.
Find the \(n\)th term of this sequence.
Use \(n=2\) to find the sum of the first two terms in this sequence.
Find the 3rd term of this sequence.
The **sum of the first \(n\) terms** of another sequence is \(\frac{n}{2}(5 n-1)\).
Expand.
Write down the inequality in \(y\) shown by the number line.
Hadi uses the monthly plan.
Calculate the total amount Hadi pays.
Find the percentage increase in the cost using the monthly plan compared to a single payment.
Hadi buys a dishwasher.
He can either pay a single payment of \(\$ 980\) or he can pay using a monthly plan. The monthly plan is \(20 \%\) of \(\$ 980\) plus 12 payments of \(\$ 75.25\) .
In a sale, the original price of a sewing machine is reduced by \(\$ 38\). This is an \(8 \%\) reduction in the original price.
Work out the original price of the sewing machine.
Write down all the factors of 18.
Factorise.
Calculate the floor area on the plan.
Give your answer in square centimetres.
13 Make \(x\) the subject of this formula.
14 The table shows some values for \(y=5 x^{2}-x^{3}-4\).
Complete the table.
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=5 x^{2}-x^{3}-4\) for \(-2 \leqslant x \leqslant 5\).
15 The height of each of 140 basketball players is recorded. The table shows the results.
Calculate an estimate of the mean height.
cm [4]
Two of the players are chosen at random.
Find the probability that both players have a height greater than 190 cm and no more than 200 cm.
Complete the histogram to show the information in the frequency table.
Calculate the value of \(r\).
[Turn over]
By drawing a suitable straight line on the grid, solve the equation \(x^{3}-5 x^{2}-x+14=0\).
<label>
where \(x\) and \(y\) are positive integers.
Using your answers to **part (a)** and **part (b)**, find one possible value of \(x\) and the corresponding value of \(y\).
A warehouse has a floor area of \(800 \mathrm{~m}^{2}\).
The plan of the warehouse is drawn to a scale of \(1:50\).
[Turn over]
The diagram shows triangle \(PQR\).
Calculate the shortest distance from \(Q\) to \(PR\).
Calculate \(A D\).
Calculate the obtuse angle \(B D C\).
Calculate the area of the quadrilateral.
Find the values of \(a, b\) and \(c\).
16 Mateo invests $1250 at a rate of \(r \%\) per year compound interest. At the end of 6 years the total value of his investment is $1484.
The diagram shows a quadrilateral \(A B C D\).
18 \(2 x^{2}+12 x-2\) can be written in the form \(a(x+b)^{2}-c\).
The diagram shows a major sector of a circle with radius 7.5 cm.
Calculate the perimeter of the major sector.
Calculate the angle that \(O A\) makes with the base.
The diagram shows a frustum of the pyramid \(OABCD\). The height of the frustum is 16cm.
Calculate the volume of the frustum.
Question 21 is on page 16.
The diagram shows a pyramid \(OABCD\).
The pyramid has a square base, \(A B C D\), with sides 10.5 cm. The vertex \(O\) is vertically above the centre of the base, \(M\). The height of the pyramid is 24 cm.
NOT TO SCALE
Find \(m\) in terms of \(n\).
\(V\) is 50, correct to the nearest 10.
\(R\) is 13, correct to the nearest integer.
Calculate the upper bound of \(I\).
